volunteersJson.name: Eric Jackson
volunteersJson.title: The truth is that entrepreneurship is more like a roller coaster ride than a cruise.

answers.answer: I'm the Founder of World Economic Forum. Working for more than a decade in the industry, I realized my passion to do more which made me launch two startups that failed miserably. I finally found success when World Economic Forum grew to 100k+ visitors within a month.
We're doing our first local event for economics next month & I'm really excited as well as nervous for the event.
Facebook has always worked for me. It is the fastest, oldest and easiest platform.
Flyers and billboards have proved to give us great ROI.
Being an economic forum, we often come across extremely difficult situations with big companies. We sometimes do not have the expertise required and need to go head hunting for the right expert.

nodes.schedule: What’s your current position & how did you reach here?
What will success look like for you in your work in the next few weeks?
Which social media platform is working best for your brand at the moment? Why do you think that is?
What have you found to be the most effective marketing tactic/platform, beyond social media?
What are you actively focused on learning about these days and how?
If you had the time to add one more project or tactic, what would it be, and why?
What has been your biggest challenge recently and how did you overcome it?
What is your #1 tip for a new founder?
What is a key metric you’re measuring these days, and why?
What is your biggest goal or obstacle?
